newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian diamond group head Bychkov resigns - Tass.
newsitem.headline: Russian diamond group head Bychkov resigns - Tass.

text.p: Russian Diamond Cutters' Association president Yevgeny Bychkov has resigned, Itar-Tass news agency quoted sources in the group as saying on Thursday.

Bychkov is the former head of the disbanded State Committee for Precious Metals and Stones, or Komdragmet, and a proponent of greater rough gem supplies for domestic cutters and polishers and fewer Russian supplies for De Beers.

Alexander Shkadov, the association's board chairman and general director of Kristall, Russia's biggest diamond-cutting firm, based in Smolensk, would take over leadership of the association, Tass said.

It gave no reason for Bychkov's resignation, quoting an association source as saying only that a new, more effective level of operation was needed for the organisation, which groups Russian diamond cutting factories and banks.
